Sentencas: The deposition of Cr on cathode materials in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is complex and impacted by multiple factors.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In this report, a mathematical model based on electrochemical Cr-poisoning mechanism is developed to investigate the correlation between gas transport and Cr deposition in porous strontium doped lanthanum manganite/yttria stabilized zirconia (LSM/YSZ) cathode.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Time evolution of cathode pore size and three phase boundaries (TPBs) in different cathode regions with Cr2O3 deposition is analyzed.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The distribution of local current density in the cathode, the lifetime, the concentration polarization, the activation polarization and area specific resistance of SOFC cathodes are subsequently assessed quantitatively.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Three types of LSM/YSZ cathode structures with uniform, ascending and descending gradient pore-size distributions are compared.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The results show that uniform pore distribution contributes to the best performance when all the cathodes own TPBs with the same initial length.
Titulo: A model study on correlation between microstructure-gas diffusion and Cr deposition in porous LSM/YSZ cathodes of solid oxide fuel cells
